title: Yahoo Mail doesn't work when use Firefox but does work on Chrome
content: There are problems with Yahoo Mail using Firefox but it does work when I use Chrome or my Android phone. I can only read e-mails. Cannot reply, delete, move emails. My Contacts / Address Book is empty. Most of the settings are missing. Only about 30 e-mails from the last 3 days are available. Older ones are greyed out. This happens on a Windows 11 All-in-One desktop but Yahoo Mail works on Firefox on a Windows 10 tower computer. Need more details?
creator: mjkaltenbach

title: Perdi todos os meus favoritos, não tenho como recuperar?
content: Eu tive que fazer uma formatação no meu computador pois o mesmo estava lento. Depois de ter instalado o windows eu instalei o Firefox e mesmo conectando na minha conta firefox os meus favoritos todos sumiram. Não tem como mesmo eu recuperá-los ou entrar em contato com o suporte da firefox para resolver isso? Eu achei que o Sync também salvava os favoritos igual em outros navegadores.
creator: lucianavieira62

title: Trojan blocked after downloading latest update
content:

title: Text highlight color as Windows accent color
content:
Hello,

I am trying to change the text highlighting color, the blue color when I select text to copy and paste. It used to be the same color as my accent color in Windows settings, but now it has changed back to blue despite me not changing anything. This same color was also showing in the extension SoundFixer, which has 2 sliders using the same color, which is now blue. How can I change the color back to using my Windows accent color?

I'm using Firefox Developer Edition 104.0b2 (64-bit) on Windows 11 version 21H2 (10.0.22000.795)
creator: luke07758

title: 2021 and I'm still losing TABS.
content:
I have Firefox running and have several tabs open. I have checked the proper boxes to save and re-open the tabs from the previous close. This works amazingly well; often for vastly extended periods of time, as in months or years. Then I accidentally close the main window holding the desired tabs while having a second window open with some temporary webpage I was using earlier in the day hidden behind another window. Yes, it's almost not too late to save the mistake but it is often late in the evening and I just don't have the time to remember or find the correct steps to restore the lost tabs. Like what just happened to me at the end of my last session. I try and fail, and then try sleeping! Also, if a tab sits for a few sessions without actually being activated by a mouse click, my experience suggests it is lost from history.

Pease for the love of gawd fix this!!!

There are several obvious choices for the programmers to consider. 1.) close the "main" and all other windows open with Firefox. On restarting Firefox open all the previously open windows. 2.) let the user assign or define a master opening page with the desired web pages set as tabs. Then until 100 thousand years have passed always open this page with the defined tabs as set by the user. :-) 3.) do something else even more magical.

Finally, if anyone can update the steps to restore session tabs for version ~102. I've viewed several Q/A on restoring TABS but they seem to no longer apply. I cannot restore from history, so I'll need to go a little deeper into the woods. Thank you so much!
creator: rdb1956

title: PROBLEMAS CON MI CUENTA
content: Srs. Soporte de Mozilla accounts Dios los bendiga siempre. Tengo problemas hace tiempo con Firefox acounts hace aproximadamente un año, he seguido todos los pasos de cambio de contraseña, cambio de cuenta principal, cambio en varios pasos, he hecho creo yo todas las recomendaciones y hasta este momento no me funciona. Razon por la que les agradezco en gran manera me ayuden de manera facil y sencilla a resolver este impase molestoso. Muchas gracias por su ayuda para solucionar este inconveniente de tanto tiempo
creator: bolmervillanueva

title: Quit Firefox
content: After all these years I am giving up on Firefox and discontinuing my donation to Mozilla. Last year or so I have faced so many unsolvable heads. The latest is that every time I open Verizon (or refresh it) I not only asks me to sign in but asks the security question....sometimes 5 times in the same hour. I've clicked of the double security on the Verizon page. (but it's been turned off for a long time anyway). The point is there is absolutely not one person or place to turn to for help. So goodby Firefox, it's been fun.
creator: dpappas28
